intro: Odontostemma dimorphitrichum, commonly known as the two-tailed grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant has two distinct types of leaves, giving it its scientific name, and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of grassland ecosystems.
